node.title: New age of the asterisk? Integrity of elite sport under pressure as pandemic goalposts shift
node.alt: A man with security on his shirt and another with a walkie talkie stand in front of a sign with a woman with a mask
node.description: The positive COVID-19 test of cricketer Will Sutherland exposed a threat to the integrity of sporting competitions set to be repeated time and again over the coming months as Australia learns to live with COVID-19.
node.content:
["The positive COVID-19 test of cricketer Will Sutherland on Friday did more than delay the Sheffield Shield match between NSW and Victoria.", "It exposed a threat to the integrity of sporting competitions that is set to be repeated\u00a0over the coming months as Australia learns to live with COVID-19.", "When Sutherland's initial test raised concerns of a possible case, the cricket authorities did the sensible thing and made the Victorian team isolate while more tests were carried out.", "A day later, Sutherland's COVID-19 case was confirmed.", "", "
Victorian cricketer\u00a0Will Sutherland, second from right,\u00a0celebrates a wicket against New South Wales earlier this month at the MCG.(AAP: Hamish Blair)
", "NSW health guidelines require vaccinated people who are close contacts of cases to self-isolate for seven days. On face value, that would have meant Victoria's players would have been unable to take the field.", "But the NSW government\u00a0has recently narrowed the definition of a close contact in light of the vaccination rollout, meaning co-workers of a positive case are unlikely to be forced to isolate.", "Cricket Australia's chief medical officer, John Orchard, said the Victorians could take the field the following day as long as they tested negative.", "\"As such, and due to their compliance with biosecurity protocols, all members of the Victorian squad have been deemed casual contacts.\"", "Although Victoria's players and staff had been travelling together and training side by side, they were deemed not to be close contacts by NSW Health.", "With that, the game was back on, giving Victoria's players,\u00a0excluding the isolated Sutherland, the\u00a0chance to play for points in the Sheffield Shield, which has, incidentally, already been compromised by border restrictions.", "However, athletes in other states would not be as lucky.", "
COVID-19\u00a0competitions
", "The impact of withdrawals due to COVID-19 has already been felt in\u00a0international sporting events.", "Top golfer Bryson Dechambeau was forced to pull out of\u00a0the Tokyo Olympics, alongside tennis player Coco Gauff and Portuguese surfer Frederico Morais.", "Even Australia's highest-ranked men's tennis player, Alex de Minaur, was ruled out after a positive test.", "", "
Teenage superstar Coco Gauff was forced to miss the Tokyo Olympics after testing positive for\u00a0COVID-19.(AP:\u00a0Kirsty Wigglesworth)
", "But it's one thing to withdraw due to COVID-19, and another one to be forced to sit on the sidelines after being deemed a close contact \u2026 and never ultimately get the virus.", "As it happened, Friday was also the day the Victorian government lowered its burden for those exposed to COVID-19 cases.", "Close contacts \u2014 excluding household contacts \u2014\u00a0are now only required to isolate until they produce a negative PCR test, rather than isolate for seven days from the point of exposure.", "The NSW government is reportedly considering making the same tweak.", "Had Sutherland tested positive in a different jurisdiction, more players in a touring Victorian side may have been deemed close contacts, and those may have been blocked from playing.", "For example, in Western Australia, ahead of the AFL grand final in September, a COVID-19 positive truck driver sent six service station attendants into isolation.", "Whereas a vaccinated player in Victoria deemed a close contact could be back in training within a day, in Western Australia or Queensland, a player in the same circumstances could miss 14 days \u2014\u00a0or two rounds of footy \u2014\u00a0under current public health orders.", "", "
Victoria eased restrictions last week.
", "Given how stubborn border restrictions have been, aligning these regulations may take some time.", "The codes are\u00a0grappling with this very problem as they prepare COVID-19 protocols for the summer and coming 2022 seasons.", "For instance, the A-League Men\u00a0competition started on the weekend and a spokesperson was proud to declare there are currently no unvaccinated players training and 99 per cent of A-League players and high-performance staff are fully vaccinated.", "However, when it comes to COVID-19 protocols, the league wasn't prepared to disclose exactly how long a close contact would\u00a0be out for, and whether the period was consistent across teams in all states.", "As competitions move away from rigid biosecurity bubbles, it will be up to players to keep themselves COVID-19 free, and reduce the chances they will be caught up as close contacts in jurisdictions where it matters.", "
Vaccination realities
", "Vaccination rules across borders are already changing rosters and\u00a0the competitive landscape.", "", "
Former\u00a0AFLW player Deni Varnhagen chose to resign from the Crows due to the vaccine mandate.(ABC News)
", "The Victorian government's vaccination mandate, followed by the AFL, has led to Carlton's Liam Jones retiring\u00a0from the league after reportedly refusing a vaccination, and the Adelaide Crows' Deni Varnhagen stepping away from the AFLW.", "In the NRL, there are fears that as many as 15 players won't be vaccinated in time for next season and these individuals are set to have a major say in how the competition shakes out.", "The Melbourne Storm's forward linchpin Nelson Asofa-Solomona is reportedly unvaccinated and may not be able to train or play in Victoria, meaning he will almost certainly either be forced to change clubs or be out of a job.", "And Queensland's requirement for those using its public stadiums to have jabs means perhaps the game's best forward, Jason Taumalolo \u2014 another reportedly refusing a vaccination \u2014 would miss at least half of North Queensland's matches. That's\u00a0if the club decides to keep him.", "Decisions of Australian health officials are not only influencing domestic sporting outcomes either.", "The ultimate champion in the greatest era of men's tennis may be decided by Victoria's vaccination policy requiring travellers to be fully vaccinated.", "", "
His 2021 triumph may be Novak's Djokovic's final Australian Open.(AP: Hamish Blair)
", "Novak Djokovic \u2014\u00a0chasing a men's record 21st major singles title, which would be one more than\u00a0both Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal \u2014\u00a0is yet to indicate whether he will travel to Melbourne Park, as radio silence continues between him and Australian Open organisers.", "\"I haven't been talking to them to be honest,\" Djokovic said over the weekend.", "\"I was just waiting to hear what the news was going to be and, now that I know, we'll just have to wait and see.\"", "Do you know more?\u00a0Contact Jack Snape by email at jack.snape@abc.net.au or confidentially via the Signal messaging app: 61439695398."]
